title: Shenandoah National Park: Camping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Outdoor Activities     Camping                Camping          NPS photo         NPS/Alan Williams  Campgrounds There are four campgrounds in Shenandoah National Park. Mathews Arm (mile 22.1) Big Meadows (mile 51.2) Lewis Mountain (mile 57.5)  Loft Mountain (mile 79.5)   More information...           NPS photo  Backcountry Camping Most of Shenandoah National Park, including its wilderness, is open to backcountry camping. A free permit is required for backcountry camping. More information...
